Title: Mathematical modeling of simultaneous carbon-nitrogen-sulfur removal from industrial wastewater
Authors: Xi-Jun Xu, Chuan Chen, Ai-Jie Wang, Bing-Jie Ni, Wan-Qian Guo, Ye Yuan, Cong Huang, Xu Zhou, Dong-Hai Wu, Duu-Jong Lee, Nan-Qi Ren
Abstract: A mathematical model of carbon, nitrogen and sulfur removal (C-N-S) from industrial wastewater was constructed considering the interactions of sulfate-reducing bacteria (SRB), sulfide-oxidizing bacteria (SOB), nitrate-reducing bacteria (NRB), facultative bacteria (FB), and methane producing archaea (MPA). For the kinetic network, the bioconversion of C-N by heterotrophic denitrifiers ($NO_3^- \rightarrow NO_2^- \rightarrow N_2$), and that of C-S by SRB ($SO_4^{2-} \rightarrow S^{2-}$) and SOB ($S^{2-} \rightarrow S^0$) was proposed and calibrated based on batch experimental data. The model closely predicted the profiles of nitrate, nitrite, sulfate, sulfide, lactate, acetate, methane and oxygen under both anaerobic and micro-aerobic conditions. The best-fit kinetic parameters had small 95% confidence regions with mean values approximately at the center. The model was further validated using independent data sets generated under different operating conditions. This work was the first successful mathematical modeling of simultaneous C-N-S removal from industrial wastewater and more importantly, the proposed model was proven feasible to simulate other relevant processes, such as sulfate-reducing, sulfide-oxidizing process (SR-SO) and denitrifying sulfide removal (DSR) process. The model developed is expected to enhance our ability to predict the treatment of carbon-nitrogen-sulfur contaminated industrial wastewater.
GEMINI_What_problem_does_this_paper_atte: - The simultaneous biological removal of carbon, nitrogen, and sulfur (C-N-S) from industrial wastewater involves complex interactions among various microorganisms.\n- Although simultaneous C-N-S removal has been widely studied, there is a lack of mathematical modeling for the integrated process, especially regarding the synergistic and competitive relationships among these microorganisms.
GEMINI_How_the_paper_solves_this_problem:
- Constructed a mathematical model incorporating Activated Sludge Models (ASMs) and extended Anaerobic Digestion Model No. 1 (ADM1) with sulfate reduction.
- Included oxygen/nitrate-driven sulfide oxidation processes.
- Modeled the interactions of sulfate-reducing bacteria (SRB), sulfide-oxidizing bacteria (SOB), nitrate-reducing bacteria (NRB), facultative bacteria (FB), and methane producing archaea (MPA).
- Calibrated and validated the model using batch experimental data under anaerobic and micro-aerobic conditions.
- Estimated key kinetic parameters, particularly the competitive coefficients between SRB and NRB.
GEMINI_What_experiments_were_done_for_th:
- Conducted batch experiments using sludge cultivated in two laboratory-scale expanded granular sludge bed reactors (EGSB-1 and EGSB-2).
- Culture 1: Investigated carbon-nitrate-sulfate removal under anaerobic conditions with varying initial nitrate concentrations (200, 500, 700 mg/L).
- Culture 2: Investigated carbon-nitrate-sulfate removal under limited oxygen (micro-aerobic) conditions with varying initial oxygen additions to generate different $O_2$ to $SO_4^{2-}-S$ molar ratios ($R_{OS}$).
- Measured the concentrations of sulfate, nitrate, nitrite, sulfide, lactate, acetate, methane, and oxygen over time.
GEMINI_What_are_the_points_that_can_be_e:
- Methane production from $H_2$ was not considered and could be incorporated if more information on hydrogenotrophic methanogens becomes available.
- The model ignores the occurrence of some precipitation in the presence of $SO_4^{2-}$ in real wastewater.
- Real wastewater has more complex organic carbon constituents than lactate, requiring further adaptation of the model.
- Model calibration and validation with long-term studies and different carbon sources representative of large-scale real systems are needed.
GEMINI_Summarize_the_main_points_of_the_:
- Developed the first mathematical model for simultaneous C-N-S removal from industrial wastewater.
- The model successfully predicted the dynamics of nitrate, nitrite, sulfate, sulfide, lactate, acetate, methane, and oxygen under anaerobic and micro-aerobic conditions.
- Identified and calibrated key kinetic parameters, showing good identifiability with small 95% confidence regions.
- The model is versatile and can simulate other relevant processes like SR-SO (sulfate-reducing, sulfide-oxidizing) and DSR (denitrifying sulfide removal).
- Provides theoretical guidance for optimizing biological C-N-S removal processes and mitigating toxic sulfide emissions.

zh_Abstract: 建立了一个考虑硫酸盐还原菌 (SRB)、硫化物氧化菌 (SOB)、硝酸盐还原菌 (NRB)、兼性菌 (FB) 和产甲烷古菌 (MPA) 相互作用的工业废水碳、氮、硫 (C-N-S) 去除数学模型。对于动力学网络，基于间歇实验数据提出并校准了异养反硝化菌对 C-N 的生物转化 ($NO_3^- \rightarrow NO_2^- \rightarrow N_2$)，以及 SRB ($SO_4^{2-} \rightarrow S^{2-}$) 和 SOB ($S^{2-} \rightarrow S^0$) 对 C-S 的生物转化。该模型准确预测了厌氧和微氧条件下硝酸盐、亚硝酸盐、硫酸盐、硫化物、乳酸、乙酸、甲烷和氧气的分布。最佳拟合动力学参数具有较小的 95% 置信区间，平均值大约在中心位置。使用在不同操作条件下生成的独立数据集进一步验证了该模型。这项工作是首次成功对工业废水中同时去除 C-N-S 进行数学建模，更重要的是，所提出的模型被证明可以模拟其他相关过程，例如硫酸盐还原-硫化物氧化过程 (SR-SO) 和反硝化除硫 (DSR) 过程。开发的模型有望提高我们预测碳-氮-硫污染工业废水处理的能力。
GEMINI_zh_What_problem_does_this_paper_a: - 工业废水中碳、氮、硫 (C-N-S) 的同步生物去除涉及多种微生物之间的复杂相互作用。\n- 尽管同步 C-N-S 去除已被广泛研究，但缺乏针对该集成过程的数学模型，特别是在描述这些微生物之间的协同和竞争关系方面。
GEMINI_zh_How_the_paper_solves_this_prob:
- 构建了一个结合活性污泥模型 (ASMs) 和包含硫酸盐还原的扩展厌氧消化模型 No. 1 (ADM1) 的数学模型。
- 在模型中引入了氧气/硝酸盐驱动的硫化物氧化过程。
- 对硫酸盐还原菌 (SRB)、硫化物氧化菌 (SOB)、硝酸盐还原菌 (NRB)、兼性菌 (FB) 和产甲烷古菌 (MPA) 的相互作用进行了建模。
- 利用厌氧和微氧条件下的间歇实验数据对模型进行了校准和验证。
- 估算了关键的动力学参数，特别是 SRB 和 NRB 之间的竞争系数。
GEMINI_zh_What_experiments_were_done_for:
- 使用在两个实验室规模的膨胀颗粒污泥床反应器 (EGSB-1 和 EGSB-2) 中培养的污泥进行间歇实验。
- 培养物 1：研究了厌氧条件下不同初始硝酸盐浓度（200、500、700 mg/L）的碳-硝酸盐-硫酸盐去除情况。
- 培养物 2：研究了限氧（微氧）条件下，通过不同的初始氧气添加量产生不同的 $O_2$ 与 $SO_4^{2-}-S$ 摩尔比 ($R_{OS}$) 时的碳-硝酸盐-硫酸盐去除情况。
- 随时间测量了硫酸盐、硝酸盐、亚硝酸盐、硫化物、乳酸、乙酸、甲烷和氧气的浓度。
GEMINI_zh_What_are_the_points_that_can_b:
- 模型未考虑由 $H_2$ 产生甲烷的过程，如果未来能获得更多关于氢营养型产甲烷菌的信息，可以对此进行修订。
- 模型忽略了实际废水中存在 $SO_4^{2-}$ 时可能发生的一些沉淀现象。
- 实际废水中的有机碳成分比乳酸复杂得多，需要进一步调整模型以适应实际废水。
- 需要使用代表大型实际系统的不同碳源和长期研究数据来进行模型的校准和验证。
GEMINI_zh_Summarize_the_main_points_of_t:
- 开发了第一个用于工业废水同步 C-N-S 去除的数学模型。
- 该模型成功预测了厌氧和微氧条件下硝酸盐、亚硝酸盐、硫酸盐、硫化物、乳酸、乙酸、甲烷和氧气的动态变化。
- 识别并校准了关键动力学参数，显示出良好的可识别性和较小的 95% 置信区间。
- 该模型具有通用性，可用于模拟其他相关过程，如 SR-SO（硫酸盐还原-硫化物氧化）和 DSR（反硝化除硫）。
- 为优化生物 C-N-S 去除工艺和减少有毒硫化物排放提供了理论指导。
